body:
This looks good -- only one substantive issue.

---

Reviewed 30 of 30 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

*[src/core/ext/lb_policy/grpclb/grpclb.c, line 590 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/9664#-Kcdh1nT41vNRVP4EGR7:-Kcdh1nT41vNRVP4EGR8:b-c9bv9h) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/f51abe5bc860c0915b345cd7168ed1f3fb6ebe96/src/core/ext/lb_policy/grpclb/grpclb.c#L590)):*
> ```C
>   grpc_lb_policy_args args;
>   memset(&args, 0, sizeof(args));
>   args.client_channel_factory = glb_policy->cc_factory;
> ```

I think we need to set args.combiner here, in order to make sure that the RR policy uses the same combiner as the grpclb policy.

---

*[src/core/ext/lb_policy/pick_first/pick_first.c, line 63 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/9664#-KcdFZuzipK0XeLWv-FV:-KcdFZuzipK0XeLWv-FW:b-lfmp88) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/f51abe5bc860c0915b345cd7168ed1f3fb6ebe96/src/core/ext/lb_policy/pick_first/pick_first.c#L63)):*
> ```C
>   /** remaining members are protected by the combiner */
> 
>   /** the selected channel (a grpc_connected_subchannel) */
> ```

No need for the type in the comment anymore.

---

*[src/core/ext/lb_policy/pick_first/pick_first.c, line 203 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/9664#-KcdFy63F_V9WLyMtvK9:-KcdFy63F_V9WLyMtvKA:bq48qe1) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/f51abe5bc860c0915b345cd7168ed1f3fb6ebe96/src/core/ext/lb_policy/pick_first/pick_first.c#L203)):*
> ```C
>   }
> 
>   /* No subchannel selected yet, so acquire lock and then attempt again */
> ```

The "acquire lock" part of the comment is no longer accurate.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/9664#-:-KcdhWArkFCtFZo8ERXf:b-hexg51)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
I think I hit all review comments (and fixed remaining bugs)

I think you mean git submodules were deliberately badly designed.

In any case, fixed :)
